A vrock has a 30 percent chance of summoning 2d4 dretches or one vrock.
A summoned demon appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of its summoner, acts as an ally of its summoner, and can't summon other demons. It remains for 1 minute, until it or its summoner dies, or until its summoner dismisses it as an action.
LANG-KEY-the-destination-you-choose-must: The destination you choose must be known to you, and it must be on the same plane of existence as you. Your familiarity with the destination determines whether you arrive there successfully. The DM rolls d100 and consults the table.
LANG-KEY-the-deva-has-advantage-on-savin: The deva has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
LANG-KEY-the-deva-magically-polymorphs-i:
The deva magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating equal to or less than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the deva's choice).
In a new form, the deva retains its game statistics and ability to speak, but its AC, movement modes, Strength, Dexterity, and special senses are replaced by those of the new form, and it gains any statistics and capabilities (except class features, legendary actions, and lair actions) that the new form has but that it lacks.
LANG-KEY-the-deva-makes-two-melee-attack: The deva makes two melee attacks.
LANG-KEY-the-deva-touches-another-creatu: The deva touches another creature. The target magically regains 20 (4d8 + 2) hit points and is freed from any curse, disease, poison, blindness, or deafness.
LANG-KEY-the-devas-spellcasting-ability-:
The deva's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 17). The deva can innately cast the following spells, requiring only verbal components:
At will: detect evil and good
1/day each: commune, raise dead
LANG-KEY-the-devas-weapon-attacks-are-ma: The deva's weapon attacks are magical. When the deva hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 4d8 radiant damage (included in the attack).
LANG-KEY-the-development-of-land-is-camo: The development of land is camouflaged to look natural. Any creature that does not see the area when the spell is spell casts must make a Wisdom (Perception) opposite the DD backup your fate or it does not recognize the dangerous nature of the ground before entering.
LANG-KEY-the-devil-cant-be-frightened-wh: The devil can't be frightened while it can see an allied creature within 30 feet of it.
LANG-KEY-the-devil-has-advantage-on-savi: The devil has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
LANG-KEY-the-devil-magically-forms-an-op:
The devil magically forms an opaque wall of ice on a solid surface it can see within 60 feet of it. The wall is 1 foot thick and up to 30 feet long and 10 feet high, or it's a hemispherical dome up to 20 feet in diameter.
When the wall appears, each creature in its space is pushed out of it by the shortest route. The creature chooses which side of the wall to end up on, unless the creature is incapacitated. The creature then makes a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw, taking 35 (10d6) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
The wall lasts for 1 minute or until the devil is incapacitated or dies. The wall can be damaged and breached; each 10-foot section has AC 5, 30 hit points, vulnerability to fire damage, and immunity to acid, cold, necrotic, poison, and psychic damage. If a section is destroyed, it leaves behind a sheet of frigid air in the space the wall occupied. Whenever a creature finishes moving through the frigid air on a turn, willingly or otherwise, the creature must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw, taking 17 (5d6) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The frigid air dissipates when the rest of the wall vanishes.
LANG-KEY-the-devil-makes-three-attacks-o: The devil makes three attacks: one with its bite, one with its claws, and one with its tail.
LANG-KEY-the-devil-makes-three-attacks-t: The devil makes three attacks: two with its claws and one with its sting.
LANG-KEY-the-devil-makes-three-melee-att: The devil makes three melee attacks: one with its tail and two with its claws. Alternatively, it can use Hurl Flame twice.
The devil makes three melee attacks: two with its fork and one with its tail. It can use Hurl Flame in place of any melee attack.
LANG-KEY-the-devil-makes-two-attacks-one: The devil makes two attacks: one with its beard and one with its glaive.
LANG-KEY-the-devil-makes-two-attacks-wit: The devil makes two attacks with its chains.
LANG-KEY-the-disk-is-immobile-while-you-: The disk is immobile while you are within 20 feet of it. If you move more than 20 feet away from it, the disk follows you so that it remains within 20 feet of you. If can move across uneven terrain, up or down stairs, slopes and the like, but it can't cross an elevation change of 10 feet or more. For example, the disk can't move across a 10-foot-deep pit, nor could it leave such a pit if it was created at the bottom.
LANG-KEY-the-djinni-makes-three-scimitar: The djinni makes three scimitar attacks.
LANG-KEY-the-djinnis-innate-spellcasting:
The djinni's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 17, +9 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: detect evil and good, detect magic, thunderwave
3/day each: create food and water (can create wine instead of water), tongues, wind walk
1/day each: conjure elemental (air elemental only), creation, gaseous form, invisibility, major image, plane shift
LANG-KEY-the-dm-has-the-celestials-stati: The DM has the celestial's statistics.
LANG-KEY-the-dm-has-the-creatures-statis: The DM has the creatures' statistics.
LANG-KEY-the-dm-has-the-elementals-stati: The DM has the elemental's statistics.
LANG-KEY-the-dm-has-the-fey-creatures-st: The DM has the fey creature's statistics.
LANG-KEY-the-dm-might-allow-you-to-choos: The DM might allow you to choose different targets. For example, if you transform a bee, its giant version might have the same statistics as a giant wasp.
LANG-KEY-the-dog-has-advantage-on-wisdom: The dog has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, or knocked unconscious.
The dog has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.
LANG-KEY-the-dog-magically-teleports-alo: The dog magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 40 ft. to an unoccupied space it can see. Before or after teleporting, the dog can make one bite attack.
LANG-KEY-the-dog-makes-two-bite-attacks: The dog makes two bite attacks.
LANG-KEY-the-doppelganger-can-use-its-ac: The doppelganger can use its action to polymorph into a Small or Medium humanoid it has seen, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.
LANG-KEY-the-doppelganger-has-advantage-: The doppelganger has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has surprised.
LANG-KEY-the-doppelganger-magically-read: The doppelganger magically reads the surface thoughts of one creature within 60 ft. of it. The effect can penetrate barriers, but 3 ft. of wood or dirt, 2 ft. of stone, 2 inches of metal, or a thin sheet of lead blocks it. While the target is in range, the doppelganger can continue reading its thoughts, as long as the doppelganger's concentration isn't broken (as if concentrating on a spell). While reading the target's mind, the doppelganger has advantage on Wisdom (Insight) and Charisma (Deception, Intimidation, and Persuasion) checks against the target.
LANG-KEY-the-doppelganger-makes-two-mele: The doppelganger makes two melee attacks.
LANG-KEY-the-double-target-in-all-dimens: The double target in all dimensions, and its weight is multiplied by eight. This increases the size of a class of M to G for example. If there is not enough space in the room for the double target size, the creature or object reaches the maximum size possible in the available space. Until the end of the spell, the target also has the advantage of its jets Force and Force saves. Weapons to the target also grow. As long as these weapons are enlarged, the target's attacks cause additional 1d4 damage.

LANG-KEY-the-dragon-can-breathe-air-and-: The dragon can breathe air and water.
LANG-KEY-the-dragon-can-move-across-and-: The dragon can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost it extra moment.
LANG-KEY-the-dragon-can-use-its-frightfu: The dragon can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.
LANG-KEY-the-dragon-exhales-acid-in-a-15: The dragon exhales acid in a 15-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 (Sd8) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
LANG-KEY-the-dragon-exhales-acid-in-a-30: The dragon exhales acid in a 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 49 (11d8) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
LANG-KEY-the-dragon-exhales-acid-in-a-60: The dragon exhales acid in a 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw, taking 54 (12d8) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
LANG-KEY-the-dragon-exhales-acid-in-a-90: The dragon exhales acid in a 90-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 22 Dexterity saving throw, taking 67 (15d8) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
LANG-KEY-the-dragon-exhales-an-icy-blast: The dragon exhales an icy blast in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 45 (10d8) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The dragon exhales an icy blast in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 19 Constitution saving throw, taking 54 (12d8) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The dragon exhales an icy blast in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 22 Constitution saving throw, taking 72 (l6d8) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

LANG-KEY-the-dragon-exhales-fire-in-a-15: The dragon exhales fire in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC l3 Dexterity saving throw, taking 24 (7d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
LANG-KEY-the-dragon-exhales-fire-in-a-30: The dragon exhales fire in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw, taking 56 (16d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
LANG-KEY-the-dragon-exhales-fire-in-a-60: The dragon exhales fire in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 21 Dexterity saving throw, taking 63 (18d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
LANG-KEY-the-dragon-exhales-fire-in-a-90: The dragon exhales fire in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 24 Dexterity saving throw, taking 91 (26d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
LANG-KEY-the-dragon-exhales-lightning-in: The dragon exhales lightning in a 120-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 23 Dexterity saving throw, taking 88 (16d10) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

LANG-KEY-the-dragon-exhales-poisonous-ga: The dragon exhales poisonous gas in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 11 Constitution saving throw, taking 21 (6d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

LANG-KEY-the-dragon-head-exhales-fire-in: The dragon head exhales fire in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 31 (7d8) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
LANG-KEY-the-dragon-magically-polymorphs:
The dragon magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the dragon's choice).
In a new form, the dragon retains its alignment, hit points, Hit Dice, ability to speak, proficiencies, Legendary Resistance, lair actions, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as this action. LANG-KEY-the-dretch-makes-two-attacks-on: The dretch makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.
LANG-KEY-the-drider-can-climb-difficult-: The drider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.
LANG-KEY-the-drider-has-advantage-on-sav: The drider has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the drider to sleep.
LANG-KEY-the-drider-ignores-movement-res: The drider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.
LANG-KEY-the-drider-makes-three-attacks-: The drider makes three attacks, either with its longsword or its longbow. It can replace one of those attacks with a bite attack.
LANG-KEY-the-driders-innate-spellcasting:
The drider's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 13). The drider can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: dancing lights
1/day each: darkness, faerie fire
LANG-KEY-the-drow-has-advantage-on-savin: The drow has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.
LANG-KEY-the-drows-spellcasting-ability-:
The drow's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 11). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: dancing lights
1/day each: darkness, faerie fire
LANG-KEY-the-druid-is-a-4th-level-spellc:
The druid is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following druid spells prepared:

- Cantrips (at will): druidcraft, produce flame, shillelagh
- 1st level (4 slots): entangle, longstrider, speak with animals, thunderwave
- 2nd level (3 slots): animal messenger, barkskin
LANG-KEY-the-druid-table-shows-how-many-: The Druid table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these druid spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.
LANG-KEY-the-dryad-can-communicate-with-: The dryad can communicate with beasts and plants as if they shared a language.
LANG-KEY-the-dryad-has-advantage-on-savi: The dryad has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
LANG-KEY-the-dryad-targets-one-humanoid-:
The dryad targets one humanoid or beast that she can see within 30 feet of her. If the target can see the dryad, it must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or be magically charmed. The charmed creature regards the dryad as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. Although the target isn't under the dryad's control, it takes the dryad's requests or actions in the most favorable way it can.
Each time the dryad or its allies do anything harmful to the target, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. Otherwise, the effect lasts 24 hours or until the dryad dies, is on a different plane of existence from the target, or ends the effect as a bonus action. If a target's saving throw is successful, the target is immune to the dryad's Fey Charm for the next 24 hours.
The dryad can have no more than one humanoid and up to three beasts charmed at a time.
LANG-KEY-the-dryads-innate-spellcasting-:
The dryad's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14). The dryad can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: druidcraft
3/day each: entangle, goodberry
1/day each: barkskin, pass without trace, shillelagh
LANG-KEY-the-duergar-has-advantage-on-sa: The duergar has advantage on saving throws against poison, spells, and illusions, as well as to resist being charmed or paralyzed.
LANG-KEY-the-duergar-magically-turns-inv: The duergar magically turns invisible until it attacks, casts a spell, or uses its Enlarge, or until its concentration is broken, up to 1 hour (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the duergar wears or carries is invisible with it .
LANG-KEY-the-duration-depends-on-the-obj: The duration depends on the object's material. If the object is composed of multiple materials, use the shortest duration.
LANG-KEY-the-eagle-has-advantage-on-wisd: The eagle has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.
LANG-KEY-the-eagle-makes-two-attacks-one: The eagle makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its talons.
LANG-KEY-the-efreeti-makes-two-scimitar-: The efreeti makes two scimitar attacks or uses its Hurl Flame twice.
LANG-KEY-the-efreetis-innate-spell-casti:
The efreeti's innate spell casting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: detect magic
3/day: enlarge/reduce, tongues
1/day each: conjure elemental (fire elemental only), gaseous form, invisibility, major image, plane shift, wall of fire
LANG-KEY-the-elemental-can-burrow-throug: The elemental can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the elemental doesn't disturb the material it moves through.
LANG-KEY-the-elemental-can-enter-a-hosti: The elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.
LANG-KEY-the-elemental-can-move-through-: The elemental can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. A creature that touches the elemental or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 ft. of it takes 5 (1d10) fire damage. In addition, the elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature's space on a turn, that creature takes 5 (1d10) fire damage and catches fire; until someone takes an action to douse the fire, the creature takes 5 (1d10) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.
LANG-KEY-the-elemental-deals-double-dama: The elemental deals double damage to objects and structures.
LANG-KEY-the-elemental-is-friendly-to-yo: The elemental is friendly to you and your companions for the duration. Roll initiative for the elemental, which has its own turns. It obeys any verbal commands that you issue to it (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to the elemental, it defends itself from hostile creatures but otherwise takes no actions.
LANG-KEY-the-elemental-makes-two-slam-at: The elemental makes two slam attacks.
LANG-KEY-the-elemental-makes-two-touch-a: The elemental makes two touch attacks.
LANG-KEY-the-elemental-sheds-bright-ligh: The elemental sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light in an additional 30 ft..
LANG-KEY-the-enchantment-causes-creature: The enchantment causes creatures of the kind you designated to feel an intense urge to leave the area and avoid the target. When such a creature can see the target or comes within 60 feet of it, the creature must succeed on a wisdom saving throw or become frightened. The creature remains frightened while it can see the target or is within 60 feet of it. While frightened by the target, the creature must use its movement to move to the nearest safe spot from which it can't see the target. If the creature moves more than 60 feet from the target and can't see it, the creature is no longer frightened, but the creature becomes frightened again if it regains sight of the target or moves within 60 feet of it.
LANG-KEY-the-enchantment-causes-the-spec: The enchantment causes the specified creatures to feel an intense urge to approach the target while within 60 feet of it or able to see it. When such a creature can see the target or comes within 60 feet of it, the creature must succeed on a wisdom saving throw or use its movement on each of its turns to enter the area or move within reach of the target. When the creature has done so, it can't willingly move away from the target. If the target damages or otherwise harms an affected creature, the affected creature can make a wisdom saving throw to end the effect, as described below.
LANG-KEY-the-erinyes-adds-4-to-its-ac-ag: The erinyes adds 4 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the erinyes must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.
LANG-KEY-the-erinyes-has-advantage-on-sa: The erinyes has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
LANG-KEY-the-erinyess-weapon-attacks-are: The erinyes's weapon attacks are magical and deal an extra 13 (3d8) poison damage on a hit (included in the attacks).
LANG-KEY-the-ettercap-can-climb-difficul: The ettercap can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.
LANG-KEY-the-ettercap-ignores-movement-r: The ettercap ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.
LANG-KEY-the-ettercap-makes-two-attacks-: The ettercap makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.
LANG-KEY-the-ettin-has-advantage-on-wisd: The ettin has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, and knocked unconscious.
LANG-KEY-the-ettin-makes-two-attacks-one: The ettin makes two attacks: one with its battleaxe and one with its morningstar.
LANG-KEY-the-extra-hit-points-increase-w: The extra hit points increase when you reach certain levels in this class: to 1d8 at 9th level, to 1d10 at 13th level, and to 1d12 at 17th level.
LANG-KEY-the-extradimensional-space-can-: The extradimensional space can be reached by climbing to the top of the rope. The space can hold as many as eight Medium or smaller creatures. The rope can be pulled into the space, making the rope disappear from view outside the space.
LANG-KEY-the-fanatic-has-advantage-on-sa: The fanatic has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.
LANG-KEY-the-fanatic-is-a-4th-level-spel:
The fanatic is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spell casting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 11, +3 to hit with spell attacks). The fanatic has the following cleric spells prepared:

Cantrips (at will): light, sacred flame, thaumaturgy
- 1st level (4 slots): command, inflict wounds, shield of faith
- 2nd level (3 slots): hold person, spiritual weapon
LANG-KEY-the-fanatic-makes-two-melee-att: The fanatic makes two melee attacks.
LANG-KEY-the-fey-creature-is-friendly-to: The fey creature is friendly to you and your companions for the duration. Roll initiative for the creature, which has its own turns. It obeys any verbal commands that you issue to it (no action required by you), as long as they don't violate its alignment. If you don't issue any commands to the fey creature, it defends itself from hostile creatures but otherwise takes no actions.
LANG-KEY-the-fiend-can-use-its-action-to: The fiend can use its action to polymorph into a Small or Medium humanoid, or back into its true form. Without wings, the fiend loses its flying speed. Other than its size and speed, its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.
LANG-KEY-the-fiend-ignores-the-range-res: The fiend ignores the range restriction on its telepathy when communicating with a creature it has charmed. The two don't even need to be on the same plane of existence.
LANG-KEY-the-fiend-kisses-a-creature-cha: The fiend kisses a creature charmed by it or a willing creature. The target must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw against this magic, taking 32 (5d10 + 5) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.
LANG-KEY-the-fiend-magically-enters-the-: The fiend magically enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa.
LANG-KEY-the-fire-damages-objects-in-the: The fire damages objects in the area and ignites flammable objects that aren't being worn or carried.
The fire damages objects in the area and ignites flammable objects that aren't being worn or carried. If you choose, plant life in the area is unaffected by this spell.
LANG-KEY-the-fire-ignites-any-flammable-: The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.
LANG-KEY-the-fire-spreads-around-corners: The fire spreads around corners. It ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.
LANG-KEY-the-first-time-each-turn-that-a: The first time each turn that an object enters the vortex, the object takes 2d8 bludgeoning damage; this damage occurs each round it remains in the vortex.
LANG-KEY-the-first-time-the-target-would: The first time the target would drop to 0 hit points as a result of taking damage, the target instead drops to 1 hit point, and the spell ends.
LANG-KEY-the-first-time-you-do-so-you-su: The first time you do so, you suffer no adverse effect. If you use this feature again before you finish a long rest, you take 2d12 necrotic damage for each level of the spell, immediately after you cast it. Each time you use this feature again before finishing a long rest, the necrotic damage per spell level increases by 1d12. This damage ignores resistance and immunity.
LANG-KEY-the-flames-are-around-you-a-hea: The flames are around you a heat shield or cold, your choice. The heat shield gives you cold damage resistance and the cold resistance to fire damage.
LANG-KEY-the-flaming-blade-sheds-bright-: The flaming blade sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.
LANG-KEY-the-fog-moves-10-feet-away-from: The fog moves 10 feet away from you at the start of each of your turns, rolling along the surface of the ground. The vapors, being heavier than air, sink to the lowest level of the land, even pouring down openings.
LANG-KEY-the-frog-can-breathe-air-and-wa: The frog can breathe air and water
LANG-KEY-the-frog-makes-one-bite-attack-: The frog makes one bite attack against a Small or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. The swallowed target is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the frog, and it takes 5 (2d4) acid damage at the start of each of the frog's turns. The frog can have only one target swallowed at a time. If the frog dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse using 5 ft. of movement, exiting prone.
LANG-KEY-the-frogs-long-jump-is-up-to-10: The frog's long jump is up to 10 ft. and its high jump is up to 5 ft., with or without a running start.
LANG-KEY-the-frogs-long-jump-is-up-to-20: The frog's long jump is up to 20 ft. and its high jump is up to 10 ft., with or without a running start.
LANG-KEY-the-fungus-makes-1d4-rotting-to: The fungus makes 1d4 Rotting Touch attacks.
LANG-KEY-the-gargoyle-makes-two-attacks-: The gargoyle makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.
LANG-KEY-the-ghast-and-any-ghouls-within: The ghast and any ghouls within 30 ft. of it have advantage on saving throws against effects that turn undead.
LANG-KEY-the-ghost-can-move-through-othe: The ghost can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.
LANG-KEY-the-ghost-can-see-60-ft-into-th: The ghost can see 60 ft. into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.
LANG-KEY-the-ghost-enters-the-ethereal-p: The ghost enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. It is visible on the Material Plane while it is in the Border Ethereal, and vice versa, yet it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.
LANG-KEY-the-giant-can-breathe-air-and-w: The giant can breathe air and water.
LANG-KEY-the-giant-has-advantage-on-dext: The giant has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.
LANG-KEY-the-giant-has-advantage-on-wisd: The giant has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.
LANG-KEY-the-giant-hurls-a-magical-light: The giant hurls a magical lightning bolt at a point it can see within 500 feet of it. Each creature within 10 feet of that point must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw, taking 54 (12d8) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
LANG-KEY-the-giant-makes-two-greataxe-at: The giant makes two greataxe attacks.
LANG-KEY-the-giant-makes-two-greatclub-a: The giant makes two greatclub attacks.
LANG-KEY-the-giant-makes-two-greatsword-: The giant makes two greatsword attacks.
LANG-KEY-the-giant-makes-two-morningstar: The giant makes two morningstar attacks.
LANG-KEY-the-giants-innate-spellcasting-:
The giant's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma. It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: detect magic, fog cloud, light
3/day each: feather fall, fly, misty step, telekinesis
1/day each: control weather, gaseous form

The giant's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 17). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: detect magic, feather fall, levitate, light
3/day each: control weather, water breathing
LANG-KEY-the-gibbering-mouther-makes-one: The gibbering mouther makes one bite attack and, if it can, uses its Blinding Spittle.
LANG-KEY-the-glabrezu-has-advantage-on-s: The glabrezu has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
LANG-KEY-the-glabrezu-makes-four-attacks: The glabrezu makes four attacks: two with its pincers and two with its fists. Alternatively, it makes two attacks with its pincers and casts one spell.
LANG-KEY-the-glabrezus-spellcasting-abil:
The glabrezu's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 16). The glabrezu can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: darkness, detect magic, dispel magic
1/day each: confusion, fly, power word stun
LANG-KEY-the-gladiator-adds-3-to-its-ac-: The gladiator adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the gladiator must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.
LANG-KEY-the-gladiator-has-advantage-on-: The gladiator has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.
LANG-KEY-the-gladiator-makes-three-melee: The gladiator makes three melee attacks or two ranged attacks.
LANG-KEY-the-glyph-is-nearly-invisible-r: The glyph is nearly invisible, requiring an Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC to find it.
LANG-KEY-the-glyph-is-virtually-invisibl: The glyph is virtually invisible and roll Intelligence (Investigation) against the fate of your save DC is required to find out.
LANG-KEY-the-gm-might-ask-you-to-make-a-: The GM might ask you to make a Wisdom (Survival) check to follow tracks, hunt wild game, guide your group through frozen wastelands, identify signs that owlbears live nearby, predict the weather, or avoid quicksand and other natural hazards.
LANG-KEY-the-gnome-has-advantage-on-dext: The gnome has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.
LANG-KEY-the-gnome-has-advantage-on-inte: The gnome has advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.
LANG-KEY-the-gnomes-innate-spellcasting-:
The gnome's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 11). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: nondetection (self only)
1/day each: blindness/deafness, blur, disguise self
LANG-KEY-the-goat-has-advantage-on-stren: The goat has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it prone.
LANG-KEY-the-goblin-can-take-the-disenga: The goblin can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.
LANG-KEY-the-golem-exhales-poisonous-gas: The golem exhales poisonous gas in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 19 Constitution saving throw, taking 45 (l0d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
LANG-KEY-the-golem-has-advantage-on-savi: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
LANG-KEY-the-golem-is-immune-to-any-spel: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.
LANG-KEY-the-golem-makes-two-melee-attac: The golem makes two melee attacks.
LANG-KEY-the-golem-makes-two-slam-attack: The golem makes two slam attacks.
LANG-KEY-the-golem-targets-one-or-more-c: The golem targets one or more creatures it can see within 10 ft. of it. Each target must make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw against this magic. On a failed save, a target can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the target can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. These effects last for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
LANG-KEY-the-golems-weapon-attacks-are-m: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.
LANG-KEY-the-gorgon-exhales-petrifying-g: The gorgon exhales petrifying gas in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a target begins to turn to stone and is restrained. The restrained target must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends on the target. On a failure, the target is petrified until freed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.
LANG-KEY-the-grick-has-advantage-on-dext: The grick has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.
LANG-KEY-the-grick-makes-one-attack-with: The grick makes one attack with its tentacles. If that attack hits, the grick can make one beak attack against the same target.
LANG-KEY-the-griffon-has-advantage-on-wi: The griffon has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.
LANG-KEY-the-griffon-makes-two-attacks-o: The griffon makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its claws.
LANG-KEY-the-grimlock-cant-use-its-blind: The grimlock can't use its blindsight while deafened and unable to smell.
LANG-KEY-the-grimlock-has-advantage-on-d: The grimlock has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.
LANG-KEY-the-grimlock-has-advantage-on-w: The grimlock has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.
LANG-KEY-the-ground-in-a-10-foot-radius-: The ground in a 10-foot radius around the mouther is doughlike difficult terrain. Each creature that starts its turn in that area must succeed on a DC 10 Strength saving throw or have its speed reduced to 0 until the start of its next turn.
LANG-KEY-the-ground-in-a-20-foot-radius-: The ground in a 20-foot radius centered on a point within range twists and sprouts hard spikes and thorns. The area becomes difficult terrain for the duration. When a creature moves into or within the area, it takes 2d4 piercing damage for every 5 feet it travels.
LANG-KEY-the-ground-in-the-area-becomes-: The ground in the area becomes difficult terrain. Each creature on the ground that is concentrating must make a constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature's concentration is broken.
LANG-KEY-the-ground-in-the-area-is-cover: The ground in the area is covered with slick ice, making it difficult terrain. When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, it falls prone.
LANG-KEY-the-guardian-makes-two-fist-att: The guardian makes two fist attacks.
LANG-KEY-the-gust-disperses-gas-or-vapor: The gust disperses gas or vapor, and it extinguishes candles, torches, and similar unprotected flames in the area. It causes protected flames, such as those of lanterns, to dance wildly and has a 50 percent chance to extinguish them.
LANG-KEY-the-hag-can-breathe-air-and-wat: The hag can breathe air and water.
LANG-KEY-the-hag-can-mimic-animal-sounds: The hag can mimic animal sounds and humanoid voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful DC 14 Wisdom (Insight) check.
LANG-KEY-the-hag-covers-herself-and-anyt:
The hag covers herself and anything she is wearing or carrying with a magical illusion that makes her look like an ugly creature of her general size and humanoid shape. The effect ends if the hag takes a bonus action to end it or if she dies.
The changes wrought by this effect fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, the hag could appear to have no claws, but someone touching her hand might feel the claws. Otherwise, a creature must take an action to visually inspect the illusion and succeed on a DC 16 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the hag is disguised.

The hag covers herself and anything she is wearing or carrying with a magical illusion that makes her look like another creature of her general size and humanoid shape. The illusion ends if the hag takes a bonus action to end it or if she dies.
The changes wrought by this effect fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, the hag could appear to have smooth skin, but someone touching her would feel her rough flesh. Otherwise, a creature must take an action to visually inspect the illusion and succeed on a DC 20 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the hag is disguised.
LANG-KEY-the-hag-has-advantage-on-saving: The hag has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
LANG-KEY-the-hag-magically-enters-the-et: The hag magically enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. To do so, the hag must have a heartstone in her possession.
LANG-KEY-the-hag-magically-polymorphs-in: The hag magically polymorphs into a Small or Medium female humanoid, or back into her true form. Her statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment she is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. She reverts to her true form if she dies.
LANG-KEY-the-hag-magically-turns-invisib: The hag magically turns invisible until she attacks or casts a spell, or until her concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). While invisible, she leaves no physical evidence of her passage, so she can be tracked only by magic. Any equipment she wears or carries is invisible with her.
LANG-KEY-the-hag-targets-one-frightened-: The hag targets one frightened creature she can see within 30 ft. of her. If the target can see the hag, it must succeed on a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or drop to 0 hit points.
LANG-KEY-the-hags-innate-spellcasting-ab:
The hag's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 12). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: dancing lights, minor illusion, vicious mockery

The hag's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: detect magic, magic missile
2/day each: plane shift (self only), ray of enfeeblement, sleep
LANG-KEY-the-hand-attempts-to-grapple-a-: The hand attempts to grapple a Huge or smaller creature within 5 feet of it. You use the hand's Strength score to resolve the grapple. If the target is Medium or smaller, you have advantage on the check. While the hand is grappling the target, you can use a bonus action to have the hand crush it. When you do so, the target takes bludgeoning damage equal to 2d6 + your spellcasting ability modifier.
LANG-KEY-the-hand-attempts-to-push-a-cre: The hand attempts to push a creature within 5 feet of it in a direction you choose. Make a check with the hand's Strength contested by the Strength (Athletics) check of the target. If the target is Medium or smaller, you have advantage on the check. If you succeed, the hand pushes the target up to 5 feet plus a number of feet equal to five times your spellcasting ability modifier. The hand moves with the target to remain within 5 feet of it.
LANG-KEY-the-hand-cant-attack-activate-m: The hand can't attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.
LANG-KEY-the-hand-interposes-itself-betw: The hand interposes itself between you and a creature you choose until you give the hand a different command. The hand moves to stay between you and the target, providing you with half cover against the target. The target can't move through the hand's space if its Strength score is less than or equal to the hand's Strength score. If its Strength score is higher than the hand's Strength score, the target can move toward you through the hand's space, but that space is difficult terrain for the target.
LANG-KEY-the-hand-is-an-object-that-has-: The hand is an object that has AC 20 and hit points equal to your hit point maximum. If it drops to 0 hit points, the spell ends. It has a Strength of 26 (+8) and a Dexterity of 10 (+0). The hand doesn't fill its space.
LANG-KEY-the-hand-strikes-one-creature-o: The hand strikes one creature or object within 5 feet of it. Make a melee spell attack for the hand using your game statistics. On a hit, the target takes 4d8 force damage.
LANG-KEY-the-harpy-makes-two-attacks-one: The harpy makes two attacks: one with its claws and one with its club.
LANG-KEY-the-harpy-sings-a-magical-melod:
The harpy sings a magical melody. Every humanoid and giant within 300 ft. of the harpy that can hear the song must succeed on a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed until the song ends. The harpy must take a bonus action on its subsequent turns to continue singing. It can stop singing at any time. The song ends if the harpy is incapacitated.
While charmed by the harpy, a target is incapacitated and ignores the songs of other harpies. If the charmed target is more than 5 ft. away from the harpy, the must move on its turn toward the harpy by the most direct route. It doesn't avoid opportunity attacks, but before moving into damaging terrain, such as lava or a pit, and whenever it takes damage from a source other than the harpy, a target can repeat the saving throw. A creature can also repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the effect ends on it.
A target that successfully saves is immune to this harpy's song for the next 24 hours.
LANG-KEY-the-hawk-has-advantage-on-an-at: The hawk has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the hawk's allies is within 5 ft. of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.
LANG-KEY-the-hawk-has-advantage-on-wisdo: The hawk has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.
LANG-KEY-the-hezrou-has-advantage-on-sav: The hezrou has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
LANG-KEY-the-hezrou-makes-three-attacks-: The hezrou makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.
LANG-KEY-the-hippogriff-has-advantage-on: The hippogriff has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.
LANG-KEY-the-hippogriff-makes-two-attack: The hippogriff makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its claws.
LANG-KEY-the-hound-exhales-fire-in-a-15-: The hound exhales fire in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 (6d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
LANG-KEY-the-hound-has-advantage-on-an-a: The hound has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the hound's allies is within 5 ft. of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.
LANG-KEY-the-hound-has-advantage-on-wisd: The hound has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.
LANG-KEY-the-hound-is-invisible-to-all-c: The hound is invisible to all creatures except you and can't be harmed. When a Small or larger creature comes within 30 feet of it without first speaking the password that you specify when you cast this spell, the hound starts barking loudly. The hound sees invisible creatures and can see into the Ethereal Plane. It ignores illusions.
LANG-KEY-the-hydra-can-hold-its-breath-f: The hydra can hold its breath for 1 hour.
LANG-KEY-the-hydra-has-five-heads-while-:
The hydra has five heads. While it has more than one head, the hydra has advantage on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, and knocked unconscious.
Whenever the hydra takes 25 or more damage in a single turn, one of its heads dies. If all its heads die, the hydra dies.
At the end of its turn, it grows two heads for each of its heads that died since its last turn, unless it has taken fire damage since its last turn. The hydra regains 10 hit points for each head regrown in this way.
LANG-KEY-the-hydra-makes-as-many-bite-at: The hydra makes as many bite attacks as it has heads.
LANG-KEY-the-hyena-has-advantage-on-an-a: The hyena has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the hyena's allies is within 5 ft. of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.
LANG-KEY-the-illusion-includes-audible-v: The illusion includes audible, visual, tactile, and olfactory elements, so it can turn clear ground into difficult terrain (or vice versa) or otherwise impede movement through the area. Any piece of the illusory terrain (such as a rock or stick) that is removed from the spell's area disappears immediately.
LANG-KEY-the-imp-can-serve-another-creat: The imp can serve another creature as a familiar, forming a telepathic bond with its willing master. While the two are bonded, the master can sense what the quasit senses as long as they are within 1 mile of each other. While the imp is within 10 feet of its master, the master shares the quasit's Magic Resistance trait. At any time and for any reason, the imp can end its service as a familiar, ending the telepathic bond.
LANG-KEY-the-imp-can-use-its-action-to-p: The imp can use its action to polymorph into a beast form that resembles a rat (speed 20 ft.), a raven (20 ft., fly 60 ft.), or a spider (20 ft., climb 20 ft.), or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form, except for the speed changes noted. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.
LANG-KEY-the-imp-has-advantage-on-saving: The imp has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
LANG-KEY-the-imp-magically-turns-invisib: The imp magically turns invisible until it attacks, or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the imp wears or carries is invisible with it.
LANG-KEY-the-infernal-chill-radiating-fr: The infernal chill radiating from an ice devil's spear and the frigid blast of a white dragon's breath deal cold damage.
LANG-KEY-the-information-you-learn-is-ac: The information you learn is accurate but might be couched in figurative language. For example, if you have a mysterious magic axe on hand the spell might yield this information: "Woe to the evildoer whose hand touches the axe, for even the haft slices the hand of the evil ones. Only a true Child of Stone, lover and beloved of Moradin, may awaken the true powers of the axe, and only with the sacred word Rudnogg on the lips."
LANG-KEY-the-jackal-has-advantage-on-an-: The jackal has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the jackal's allies is within 5 ft. of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.
LANG-KEY-the-jackal-has-advantage-on-wis: The jackal has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.
LANG-KEY-the-jelly-can-climb-difficult-s: The jelly can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.
LANG-KEY-the-jelly-can-move-through-a-sp: The jelly can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.
LANG-KEY-the-knight-adds-2-to-its-ac-aga: The knight adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the knight must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.
LANG-KEY-the-knight-has-advantage-on-sav: The knight has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.
LANG-KEY-the-knight-makes-two-melee-atta: The knight makes two melee attacks.
LANG-KEY-the-kobold-has-advantage-on-an-: The kobold has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kobold's allies is within 5 ft. of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.
LANG-KEY-the-kraken-can-breathe-air-and-: The kraken can breathe air and water.
LANG-KEY-the-kraken-deals-double-damage-: The kraken deals double damage to objects and structures.
LANG-KEY-the-kraken-ignores-difficult-te: The kraken ignores difficult terrain, and magical effects can't reduce its speed or cause it to be restrained. It can spend 5 feet of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints or being grappled.
LANG-KEY-the-kraken-magically-creates-th: The kraken magically creates three bolts of lightning, each of which can strike a target the kraken can see within 120 feet of it. A target must make a DC 23 Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 (4d10) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
LANG-KEY-the-kraken-makes-one-tentacle-a: The kraken makes one tentacle attack or uses its Fling.
LANG-KEY-the-kraken-makes-three-tentacle: The kraken makes three tentacle attacks, each of which it can replace with one use of Fling.
LANG-KEY-the-lamia-makes-two-attacks-one: The lamia makes two attacks: one with its claws and one with its dagger or Intoxicating Touch.
LANG-KEY-the-lamias-innate-spellcasting-: The lamia's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 13). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components. At will: disguise self (any humanoid form), major image 3/day each: charm person, mirror image, scrying, suggestion 1/day: geas
LANG-KEY-the-lich-fixes-its-gaze-on-one-: The lich fixes its gaze on one creature it can see within 10 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or become frightened for 1 minute. The frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the lich's gaze for the next 24 hours.
LANG-KEY-the-lich-has-advantage-on-savin: The lich has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.
LANG-KEY-the-lich-is-an-18th-level-spell:
The lich is an 18th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 20, +12 to hit with spell attacks). The lich has the following wizard spells prepared:

- Cantrips (at will): mage hand, prestidigitation, ray of frost
- 1st level (4 slots): detect magic, magic missile, shield, thunderwave
- 2nd level (3 slots): acid arrow, detect thoughts, invisibility, mirror image
- 3rd level (3 slots): animate dead, counterspell, dispel magic, fireball
- 4th level (3 slots): blight, dimension door
- 5th level (3 slots): cloudkill, scrying
- 6th level (1 slot): disintegrate, globe of invulnerability
- 7th level (1 slot): finger of death, plane shift
- 8th level (1 slot): dominate monster, power word stun
- 9th level (1 slot): power word kill
LANG-KEY-the-lich-uses-its-paralyzing-to: The lich uses its Paralyzing Touch.
LANG-KEY-the-life-domain-focuses-on-the-: The Life domain focuses on the vibrant positive energy--one of the fundamental forces of the universe--that sustains all life. The gods of life promote vitality and health through healing the sick and wounded, caring for those in need, and driving away the forces of death and undeath. Almost any non-evil deity can claim influence over this domain, particularly agricultural deities, sun gods, gods of healing or endurance, and gods of home and community.
LANG-KEY-the-lightning-ignites-flammable: The lightning ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.
LANG-KEY-the-lion-has-advantage-on-an-at: The lion has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the lion's allies is within 5 ft. of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.
LANG-KEY-the-lion-has-advantage-on-wisdo: The lion has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.
LANG-KEY-the-lizard-can-climb-difficult-: The lizard can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.
LANG-KEY-the-lizard-can-hold-its-breath-: The lizard can hold its breath for 15 minutes. (A lizard that has this trait also has a swimming speed of 30 feet.)
LANG-KEY-the-lizardfolk-can-hold-its-bre: The lizardfolk can hold its breath for 15 minutes.
LANG-KEY-the-lizardfolk-makes-two-melee-: The lizardfolk makes two melee attacks, each one with a different weapon.
LANG-KEY-the-mage-is-a-9th-level-spellca:
The mage is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). The mage has the following wizard spells prepared:

- Cantrips (at will): fire bolt, light, mage hand, prestidigitation
- 1st level (4 slots): detect magic, mage armor, magic missile, shield
- 2nd level (3 slots): misty step, suggestion
- 3rd level (3 slots): counterspell, fireball, fly
- 4th level (3 slots): greater invisibility, ice storm
- 5th level (1 slot): cone of cold
LANG-KEY-the-magic-fashions-a-new-body-f: The magic fashions a new body for the creature to inhabit, which likely causes the creature's race to change. The DM rolls a d 100 and consults the following table to determine what form the creature takes when restored to life, or the DM chooses a form.
LANG-KEY-the-manticore-has-twenty-four-t: The manticore has twenty-four tail spikes. Used spikes regrow when the manticore finishes a long rest.
LANG-KEY-the-manticore-makes-three-attac: The manticore makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws or three with its tail spikes.
LANG-KEY-the-marilith-adds-5-to-its-ac-a: The marilith adds 5 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the marilith must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.
LANG-KEY-the-marilith-can-make-seven-att: The marilith can make seven attacks: six with its longswords and one with its tail.
LANG-KEY-the-marilith-can-take-one-react: The marilith can take one reaction on every turn in combat.
LANG-KEY-the-marilith-has-advantage-on-s: The marilith has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
LANG-KEY-the-marilith-magically-teleport: The marilith magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.
LANG-KEY-the-mariliths-weapon-attacks-ar: The marilith's weapon attacks are magical.
LANG-KEY-the-mastiff-has-advantage-on-wi: The mastiff has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.
LANG-KEY-the-medusa-makes-either-three-m: The medusa makes either three melee attacks--one with its snake hair and two with its shortsword--or two ranged attacks with its longbow.
LANG-KEY-the-mephit-can-innately-cast-bl: The mephit can innately cast blur, requiring no material components. Its innate spellcasting ability is Charisma.
LANG-KEY-the-mephit-can-innately-cast-fo: The mephit can innately cast fog cloud, requiring no material components. Its innate spellcasting ability is Charisma.
LANG-KEY-the-mephit-can-innately-cast-he: The mephit can innately cast heat metal (spell save DC 10), requiring no material components. Its innate spellcasting ability is Charisma.
LANG-KEY-the-mephit-can-innately-cast-sl: The mephit can innately cast sleep, requiring no material components. Its innate spellcasting ability is Charisma.
LANG-KEY-the-mephit-exhales-a-15-foot-co: The mephit exhales a 15-foot cone of blinding dust. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or be blinded for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

The mephit exhales a 15-foot cone of cold air. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw, taking 5 (2d4) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The mephit exhales a 15-foot cone of fire. Each creature in that area must make a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 (2d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The mephit exhales a 15-foot cone of scalding steam. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw, taking 4 (1d8) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
LANG-KEY-the-mephit-has-a-25-percent-cha: The mephit has a 25 percent chance of summoning 1d4 mephits of its kind. A summoned mephit appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of its summoner, acts as an ally of its summoner, and can't summon other mephits. It remains for 1 minute, until it or its summoner dies, or until its summoner dismisses it as an action.
LANG-KEY-the-merfolk-can-breathe-air-and: The merfolk can breathe air and water.
LANG-KEY-the-merrow-can-breathe-air-and-: The merrow can breathe air and water.
LANG-KEY-the-merrow-makes-two-attacks-on: The merrow makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws or harpoon.
LANG-KEY-the-mimic-adheres-to-anything-t: The mimic adheres to anything that touches it. A Huge or smaller creature adhered to the mimic is also grappled by it (escape DC 13). Ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage.
LANG-KEY-the-mimic-can-use-its-action-to: The mimic can use its action to polymorph into an object or back into its true, amorphous form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn 't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.
LANG-KEY-the-mimic-has-advantage-on-atta: The mimic has advantage on attack rolls against any creature grappled by it.
LANG-KEY-the-minotaur-can-perfectly-reca: The minotaur can perfectly recall any path it has traveled.
LANG-KEY-the-mouther-babbles-incoherentl: The mouther babbles incoherently while it can see any creature and isn't incapacitated. Each creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of the mouther and can hear the gibbering must succeed on a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature can't take reactions until the start of its next turn and rolls a d8 to determine what it does during its turn. On a 1 to 4, the creature does nothing. On a 5 or 6, the creature takes no action or bonus action and uses all its movement to move in a randomly determined direction. On a 7 or 8, the creature makes a melee attack against a randomly determined creature within its reach or does nothing if it can't make such an attack.
LANG-KEY-the-mouther-spits-a-chemical-gl: The mouther spits a chemical glob at a point it can see within 15 feet of it. The glob explodes in a blinding flash of light on impact. Each creature within 5 feet of the flash must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or be blinded until the end of the mouther's next turn.
LANG-KEY-the-mule-has-advantage-on-stren: The mule has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it prone.
LANG-KEY-the-mule-is-considered-to-be-a-: The mule is considered to be a Large animal for the purpose of determining its carrying capacity.
LANG-KEY-the-mummy-can-use-its-dreadful-: The mummy can use its Dreadful Glare and makes one attack with its rotting fist.
LANG-KEY-the-mummy-lord-has-advantage-on: The mummy lord has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
LANG-KEY-the-mummy-lord-is-a-10th-level-:
The mummy lord is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 17, +9 to hit with spell attacks). The mummy lord has the following cleric spells prepared:

- Cantrips (at will): sacred flame, thaumaturgy
- 1st level (4 slots): command, guiding bolt, shield of faith
- 2nd level (3 slots): hold person, silence, spiritual weapon
- 3rd level (3 slots): animate dead, dispel magic
- 4th level (3 slots): divination, guardian of faith
- 5th level (2 slots): contagion, insect plague
- 6th level (1 slot): harm
LANG-KEY-the-mummy-lord-magically-transf: The mummy lord magically transforms into a whirlwind of sand, moves up to 60 feet, and reverts to its normal form. While in whirlwind form, the mummy lord is immune to all damage, and it can't be grappled, petrified, knocked prone, restrained, or stunned. Equipment worn or carried by the mummy lord remain in its possession.
LANG-KEY-the-mummy-lord-magically-unleas: The mummy lord magically unleashes negative energy. Creatures within 60 feet of the mummy lord, including ones behind barriers and around corners, can't regain hit points until the end of the mummy lord's next turn.
LANG-KEY-the-mummy-lord-makes-one-attack: The mummy lord makes one attack with its rotting fist or uses its Dreadful Glare.
LANG-KEY-the-mummy-lord-targets-one-crea: The mummy lord targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. If the target can see the mummy lord, it must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or become frightened until the end of the mummy's next turn. If the target fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it is also paralyzed for the same duration. A target that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to the Dreadful Glare of all mummies and mummy lords for the next 24 hours.
LANG-KEY-the-mummy-lord-utters-a-blasphe: The mummy lord utters a blasphemous word. Each non-undead creature within 10 feet of the mummy lord that can hear the magical utterance must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of the mummy lord's next turn.
LANG-KEY-the-mummy-targets-one-creature-: The mummy targets one creature it can see within 60 ft. of it. If the target can see the mummy, it must succeed on a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or become frightened until the end of the mummy's next turn. If the target fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it is also paralyzed for the same duration. A target that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to the Dreadful Glare of all mummies (but not mummy lords) for the next 24 hours.
LANG-KEY-the-naga-is-a-10th-level-spellc:
The naga is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks), and it needs only verbal components to cast its spells. It has the following wizard spells prepared:

- Cantrips (at will): mage hand, minor illusion, ray of frost
- 1st level (4 slots): charm person, detect magic, sleep
- 2nd level (3 slots): detect thoughts, hold person
- 3rd level (3 slots): lightning bolt, water breathing
- 4th level (3 slots): blight, dimension door
- 5th level (2 slots): dominate person
LANG-KEY-the-naga-is-an-11th-level-spell:
The naga is an 11th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 16, +8 to hit with spell attacks), and it needs only verbal components to cast its spells. It has the following cleric spells prepared:

- Cantrips (at will): mending, sacred flame, thaumaturgy
- 1st level (4 slots): command, cure wounds, shield of faith
- 2nd level (3 slots): calm emotions, hold person
- 3rd level (3 slots): bestow curse, clairvoyance
- 4th level (3 slots): banishment, freedom of movement
- 5th level (2 slots): flame strike, geas
- 6th level (1 slot): true seeing
LANG-KEY-the-nalfeshnee-has-advantage-on: The nalfeshnee has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
LANG-KEY-the-nalfeshnee-magically-emits-: The nalfeshnee magically emits scintillating, multicolored light. Each creature within 15 feet of the nalfeshnee that can see the light must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the nalfeshnee's Horror Nimbus for the next 24 hours.
LANG-KEY-the-nalfeshnee-magically-telepo: The nalfeshnee magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.
LANG-KEY-the-nalfeshnee-uses-horror-nimb: The nalfeshnee uses Horror Nimbus if it can.  It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.
LANG-KEY-the-next-time-you-hit-a-creatur: The next time you hit a creature with a weapon attack before this spell ends, the weapon gleams with astral radiance as you strike. The attack deals an extra 2d6 radiant damage to the target, which becomes visible if it's invisible, and the target sheds dim light in a 5-foot radius and can't become invisible until the spell ends.
LANG-KEY-the-nightmare-and-up-to-three-w: The nightmare and up to three willing creatures within 5 feet of it magically enter the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa.
LANG-KEY-the-nightmare-can-grant-resista: The nightmare can grant resistance to fire damage to anyone riding it.
LANG-KEY-the-nightmare-sheds-bright-ligh: The nightmare sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.
LANG-KEY-the-noble-adds-2-to-its-ac-agai: The noble adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the noble must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.
LANG-KEY-the-oath-of-devotion-binds-a-pa: The Oath of Devotion binds a paladin to the loftiest ideals of justice, virtue, and order. Sometimes called cavaliers, white knights, or holy warriors, these paladins meet the ideal of the knight in shining armor, acting with honor in pursuit of justice and the greater good. They hold themselves to the highest standards of conduct, and some, for better or worse, hold the rest of the world to the same standards. Many who swear this oath are devoted to gods of law and good and use their gods' tenets as the measure of their devotion. They hold angels--the perfect servants of good--as their ideals, and incorporate images of angelic wings into their helmets or coats of arms.
LANG-KEY-the-octopus-can-breathe-only-un: The octopus can breathe only underwater.
LANG-KEY-the-octopus-has-advantage-on-de: The octopus has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made while underwater.
LANG-KEY-the-oni-magically-polymorphs-in: The oni magically polymorphs into a Small or Medium humanoid, into a Large giant, or back into its true form. Other than its size, its statistics are the same in each form. The only equipment that is transformed is its glaive, which shrinks so that it can be wielded in humanoid form. If the oni dies, it reverts to its true form, and its glaive reverts to its normal size.
LANG-KEY-the-oni-makes-two-attacks-eithe: The oni makes two attacks, either with its claws or its glaive.
LANG-KEY-the-oni-regains-10-hit-points-a: The oni regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.
LANG-KEY-the-onis-innate-spellcasting-ab:
The oni's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 13). The oni can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: darkness, invisibility
1/day each: charm person, cone of cold, gaseous form, sleep
LANG-KEY-the-onis-weapon-attacks-are-mag: The oni's weapon attacks are magical.
LANG-KEY-the-ooze-can-move-through-a-spa: The ooze can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.
LANG-KEY-the-other-side-of-the-wall-deal: The other side of the wall deals no damage.
LANG-KEY-the-otyugh-can-magically-transm: The otyugh can magically transmit simple messages and images to any creature within 120 ft. of it that can understand a language. This form of telepathy doesn't allow the receiving creature to telepathically respond.
LANG-KEY-the-otyugh-makes-three-attacks-: The otyugh makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its tentacles.
LANG-KEY-the-otyugh-slams-creatures-grap: The otyugh slams creatures grappled by it into each other or a solid surface. Each creature must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or take 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage and be stunned until the end of the otyugh's next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half the bludgeoning damage and isn't stunned.
LANG-KEY-the-owl-doesnt-provoke-opportun: The owl doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.
LANG-KEY-the-owl-has-advantage-on-wisdom: The owl has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.
LANG-KEY-the-owlbear-has-advantage-on-wi: The owlbear has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight or smell.
LANG-KEY-the-owlbear-makes-two-attacks-o: The owlbear makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its claws.
LANG-KEY-the-paladin-table-shows-how-man: The Paladin table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your spells. To cast one of your paladin spells of 1st level or higher, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.
LANG-KEY-the-panther-has-advantage-on-wi: The panther has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.
LANG-KEY-the-pit-fiend-has-advantage-on-: The pit fiend has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
LANG-KEY-the-pit-fiend-makes-four-attack: The pit fiend makes four attacks: one with its bite, one with its claw, one with its mace, and one with its tail.
LANG-KEY-the-pit-fiends-spellcasting-abi:
The pit fiend's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 21). The pit fiend can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: detect magic, fireball
3/day each: hold monster, wall of fire
LANG-KEY-the-pit-fiends-weapon-attacks-a: The pit fiend's weapon attacks are magical.
LANG-KEY-the-planetar-has-advantage-on-s: The planetar has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
LANG-KEY-the-planetar-knows-if-it-hears-: The planetar knows if it hears a lie.
LANG-KEY-the-planetar-makes-two-melee-at: The planetar makes two melee attacks.
LANG-KEY-the-planetar-touches-another-cr: The planetar touches another creature. The target magically regains 30 (6d8 + 3) hit points and is freed from any curse, disease, poison, blindness, or deafness.
LANG-KEY-the-planetars-spellcasting-abil:
The planetar's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 20). The planetar can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: detect evil and good, invisibility (self only)
3/day each: blade barrier, dispel evil and good, flame strike, raise dead
1/day each: commune, control weather, insect plague
LANG-KEY-the-planetars-weapon-attacks-ar: The planetar's weapon attacks are magical. When the planetar hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 5d8 radiant damage (included in the attack).
LANG-KEY-the-plesiosaurus-can-hold-its-b: The plesiosaurus can hold its breath for 1 hour.
LANG-KEY-the-portal-has-a-front-and-a-ba: The portal has a front and a back on each plane where it appears. Travel through the portal is possible only by moving through its front. Anything that does so is instantly transported to the other plane, appearing in the unoccupied space nearest to the portal.
LANG-KEY-the-presence-of-strong-evil-reg: The presence of strong evil registers on your senses like a noxious odor, and powerful good rings like heavenly music in your ears. As an action, you can open your awareness to detect such forces. Until the end of your next turn, you know the location of any celestial, fiend, or undead within 60 feet of you that is not behind total cover. You know the type (celestial, fiend, or undead) of any being whose presence you sense, but not its identity. Within the same radius, you also detect the presence of any place or object that has been consecrated or desecrated, as with the hallow spell.
LANG-KEY-the-priest-is-a-5th-level-spell:
The priest is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). The priest has the following cleric spells prepared:

- Cantrips (at will): light, sacred flame, thaumaturgy
- 1st level (4 slots): cure wounds, guiding bolt, sanctuary
- 2nd level (3 slots): lesser restoration, spiritual weapon
- 3rd level (2 slots): dispel magic, spirit guardians
LANG-KEY-the-protection-grants-several-b: The protection grants several benefits. Creatures of those types have disadvantage on attack rolls against the target. The target also can't be charmed, frightened, or possessed by them. If the target is already charmed, frightened, or possessed by such a creature, the target has advantage on any new saving throw against the relevant effect.
LANG-KEY-the-pseudodragon-can-magically-: The pseudodragon can magically communicate simple ideas, emotions, and images telepathically with any creature within 100 ft. of it that can understand a language.
LANG-KEY-the-pseudodragon-can-serve-anot: The pseudodragon can serve another creature as a familiar, forming a magic, telepathic bond with that willing companion. While the two are bonded, the companion can sense what the pseudodragon senses as long as they are within 1 mile of each other. While the pseudodragon is within 10 feet of its companion, the companion shares the pseudodragon's Magic Resistance trait. At any time and for any reason, the pseudodragon can end its service as a familiar, ending the telepathic bond.
LANG-KEY-the-pseudodragon-has-advantage-: The pseudodragon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
The pseudodragon has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight, hearing, or smell.
LANG-KEY-the-pudding-can-climb-difficult: The pudding can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.
LANG-KEY-the-pudding-can-move-through-a-: The pudding can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.
LANG-KEY-the-quasit-can-serve-another-cr: The quasit can serve another creature as a familiar, forming a telepathic bond with its willing master. While the two are bonded, the master can sense what the quasit senses as long as they are within 1 mile of each other. While the quasit is within 10 feet of its master, the master shares the quasit's Magic Resistance trait. At any time and for any reason, the quasit can end its service as a familiar, ending the telepathic bond.
LANG-KEY-the-quasit-can-use-its-action-t: The quasit can use its action to polymorph into a beast form that resembles a bat (speed 10 ft. fly 40 ft.), a centipede (40 ft., climb 40 ft.), or a toad (40 ft., swim 40 ft.), or back into its true form . Its statistics are the same in each form, except for the speed changes noted. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed . It reverts to its true form if it dies.
LANG-KEY-the-quasit-has-advantage-on-sav: The quasit has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
LANG-KEY-the-quasit-magically-turns-invi: The quasit magically turns invisible until it attacks or uses Scare, or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the quasit wears or carries is invisible with it.
LANG-KEY-the-questions-verbally-directed: The questions verbally directed to the target guide the train of thought. This spell is especially effective during an interrogation.
LANG-KEY-the-quipper-can-breathe-only-un: The quipper can breathe only underwater.
LANG-KEY-the-quipper-has-advantage-on-me: The quipper has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.
LANG-KEY-the-rakshasa-cant-be-affected-o: The rakshasa can't be affected or detected by spells of 6th level or lower unless it wishes to be. It has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.
LANG-KEY-the-rakshasa-makes-two-claw-att: The rakshasa makes two claw attacks
LANG-KEY-the-rakshasas-innate-spellcasti:
The rakshasa's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 18, +10 to hit with spell attacks). The rakshasa can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: detect thoughts, disguise self, mage hand, minor illusion
3/day each: charm person, detect magic, invisibility, major image, suggestion
1/day each: dominate person, fly, plane shift, true seeing
LANG-KEY-the-ranger-table-shows-how-many: The Ranger table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.
LANG-KEY-the-rat-has-advantage-on-an-att: The rat has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the rat's allies is within 5 ft. of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.
LANG-KEY-the-rat-has-advantage-on-wisdom: The rat has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.
LANG-KEY-the-raven-can-mimic-simple-soun: The raven can mimic simple sounds it has heard, such as a person whispering, a baby crying, or an animal chittering. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful DC 10 Wisdom (Insight) check.
LANG-KEY-the-reincarnated-creature-recal: The reincarnated creature recalls its former life and experiences. It retains the capabilities it had in its original form, except it exchanges its original race for the new one and changes its racial traits accordingly.
LANG-KEY-the-remorhaz-makes-one-bite-att:
The remorhaz makes one bite attack against a Medium or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, that creature takes the bite's damage and is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the remorhaz, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the remorhaz's turns.
If the remorhaz takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the remorhaz must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet oft he remorhaz. If the remorhaz dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse using 15 feet of movement, exiting prone.
LANG-KEY-the-ritual-takes-1-hour-to-perf: The ritual takes 1 hour to perform, uses 25 gp worth of powdered silver, and requires the caster to expend a 1st-level spell slot.
LANG-KEY-the-roc-has-advantage-on-wisdom: The roc has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.
LANG-KEY-the-roc-makes-two-attacks-one-w: The roc makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its talons.
